description: National dermatology society issues updated guidelines on aesthetic neuromodulator dosing and patient selection.
New regional restrictions on digital advertising for aesthetic procedures limiting before/after imagery on paid channels.
Pilot reimbursement program announced for reconstructive procedures affecting billing codes in select hospitals.
Health authority issues advisory on rare adverse events associated with dermal fillers; additional informed consent recommended.
Tighter advertising rules for aesthetic procedures introduced nationwide; expected short-term decline in elective procedures.
Mandatory accredited training requirement for clinicians administering neuromodulators in private clinics.
Clarification on scope of practice for nurse injectors issued, impacting clinic staffing models.
Temporary import restrictions on specific injectable components causing short-term supply constraints.
Updated national consent form template required for all aesthetic procedures, includes cooling-off period guidance.
New guidance on influencer-led promotion of aesthetic treatments; stricter disclosure and transparency rules.
